page.title: 03The Religion of Islam
page.content: They all have names. In order when they're read they are; Fajar in the Sunrise Zohr in the Afternoon Assar in the late Afternoon Magrib in the evening Isha at night Mosque or the place where Muslims worship and in Mecca the Kaaba are the most important buildings for Muslims. Mosque comes from the Arabic word Masjid. In a mosque there is a pulpit for the preacher and a lectern for the Quaron. We start our alphabet or writing from the right hand side towards the left. The urdu alphabet is absolutely the same except some extra which are shown in brackets. Mohammed was born in 570 A.D. he was born in the city of Mecca.
